channel.title: Lost Terminal
channel.description:
How do you learn to be human if there's no-one around to teach you?

A hopepunk podcast following the journey of a little satellite trying to understand what has happened after Earth stops returning his calls.

New episodes Mondays
channel.itunes:author: Namtao Productions
channel.itunes:subtitle:
How do you learn to be human if there's no-one around to teach you?

item.title: 1.1 - Hello World [pilot]
item.description:
Hello world, I hope you can hear me.

If you like Lost Terminal, please support me on Patreon!
https://www.patreon.com/lostterminalpod

▶️ FOLLOW ME HERE ▶️
Twitter http://twitter.com/namtaomusic
Facebook http://facebook.com/namtaomusic

▶️ LISTEN TO MY MUSIC ▶️
Spotify http://oat.sh/namtao-spotify
iTunes http://oat.sh/namtao-itunes
Google Play http://oat.sh/namtao-google-play
Bandcamp http://namtao.bandcamp.com/
And everywhere else! Just search for NAMTAO.

▶️ STUDIO EQUIPMENT ▶️
Recording mic: Røde Procaster
Audio interface: Focusrite Scarlett 2i2
Music software: Bitwig on Ubuntu Linux
Terminal software: Cool Retro Terminal

▶️ CREDITS ▶️
Credits narrated by Lucy Stringer

THANKS SO MUCH TO MY PATRONS!

item.title: 2.1 - I Feel Weird
item.description:
How do you learn to be human if there's no-one around to teach you?

Lost Terminal is a sci-fi podcast following the journey of a little A.I. trying to understand what has happened after earth stops returning his calls.

New episodes Mondays.

Today's signal is Synth Sea, by NAMTAO from the new album, c0ast, streaming everywhere.

Watch the podcast here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xBOTvsnP9Ug&list=PL95NP4bDITAloWoyDaea_Od4e3Q0MSiDx

Read A Declaration Of The Independence of Cyberspace here:
https://www.eff.org/cyberspace-independence

If you like Lost Terminal, please support us on Patreon!
https://www.patreon.com/lostterminalpod

▶️ FOLLOW ME HERE ▶️
Twitter http://twitter.com/lostterminalpod
Facebook http://facebook.com/namtaomusic

▶️ LISTEN TO NAMTAO MUSIC ▶️
Spotify http://oat.sh/namtao-spotify
iTunes http://oat.sh/namtao-itunes
Google Play http://oat.sh/namtao-google-play
Bandcamp http://namtao.bandcamp.com/
And everywhere else! Just search for NAMTAO.

▶️ STUDIO EQUIPMENT ▶️
Recording mic: Røde Procaster
Audio interface: Focusrite Scarlett 2i2
Music software: Bitwig on Ubuntu Linux
Terminal software: Cool Retro Terminal

▶️ CREDITS ▶️
Credits narrated by Lucy Stringer

THANKS SO MUCH TO OUR PATRONS!

item.itunes:summary:
To listen to the whole of The IVAN special, and get other perks and extra content, please support us on Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/lostterminalpod

Today's signal is the NAMTAO cover of, 'Let The Path Grow Over', by John Callaghan. Listen again here: https://soundcloud.com/namtao/let-the-path-grow-over-john-callaghan-cover. Listen to John's beautiful original here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P0cKq2-PMxA and check out his website at https://johncallaghan.co.uk

The season 2.0 background music is from the album 'Supervised Learning', also by NAMTAO.

Check out the videos for the podcast here:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL95NP4bDITAloWoyDaea_Od4e3Q0MSiDx

item.title: 4.2 - Do you think I sound different?
item.description:

https://www.patreon.com/lostterminalpod

The season 4.0 background music is from the albums 'Unsupervised Learning' and 'Supervised Learning', by NAMTAO.

▶️ FOLLOW US HERE ▶️
Twitter http://twitter.com/lostterminalpod

▶️ LISTEN TO MORE NAMTAO MUSIC ▶️
Spotify http://oat.sh/namtao-spotify
iTunes http://oat.sh/namtao-itunes
Google Play http://oat.sh/namtao-google-play
Bandcamp http://namtao.bandcamp.com/
And everywhere else! Just search for NAMTAO.

▶️ STUDIO EQUIPMENT ▶️
Recording mic: Røde Procaster
Audio interface: Focusrite Scarlett 2i2
Music software: Bitwig on Ubuntu Linux

▶️ CREDITS ▶️
Credits narrated by Lucy Stringer

Interested in tabletop games? Start here! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WXJxQ0NbFtk&list=PL0Y9n5uBJuXxjSe6lJEHRZICCHym3e-aS&index=8

Learn more about the Johari Window system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johari_window

Meditation beginners could start with apps like Headspace and Calm (#notspon!), but for experienced meditators looking to level up their game, I recommend the book Practical Zen, by Julian Daizan Skinner.

THANKS SO MUCH TO OUR PATRONS!

item.title: Essay: So you want to write a fiction podcast?
item.description:
I started this podcast exactly a year ago, and I have now published four, ten-episode seasons, 4 patreon-exclusive special episodes, and shipped dozens of shirts and posters to you lovely people. This episode contains everything I can think of to help you do the same.

Transcript/post: https://www.0atman.com/articles/21/make-fiction-podcast

# Links
Welcome to Night Vale
https://www.welcometonightvale.com

Within the Wires
https://www.nightvalepresents.com/withinthewires

Moonbase Theta, Out
https://monkeymanproductions.com/moonbase-theta-out/

Namtao - Want You Gone
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvLGFe_8yWU

Kurt Vonnegut on the Shapes of Stories
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oP3c1h8v2ZQ

The Guardian: How many basic plots are there in all stories ever written?
https://www.theguardian.com/books/booksblog/2016/jul/13/three-six-or-36-how-many-basic-plots-are-there-in-all-stories-ever-written

Magpie Tales by Neil Murton
https://www.amazon.co.uk/Magpie-Tales-Mr-Neil-Murton/dp/1500287849

Dan Wells on Story Structure
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KcmiqQ9NpPE

Spreaker podcast publishing
http://Spreaker.com

Cool Retro Term
https://github.com/Swordfish90/cool-retro-term

Open Broadcaster Software
https://obsproject.com/

Lightworks
https://www.lwks.com/

Bitwig http://bitwig.com

RØDE Procaster
https://www.rode.com/microphones/procaster

Start With This
https://www.nightvalepresents.com/startwiththis

item.title: Heliophage: Episode 1, 2106-04-26 (Presenting a new LT podcast!)
item.description:
Episode transcript: https://www.patreon.com/posts/54776068

Heliophage is a new bonus podcast set in the LT world. It is much darker in tone, and explores the harder side of The Collapse, contrasting Seth's more upbeat view on the world. It's written by Karl Williams (who also narrates the episodes) and Tris Oaten, whom you know already as NAMTAO, the voice of Seth.

If you like what you hear, patrons at the Amiga tier or higher will receive this new show monthly, with episode 2 on the 10th of September.

If you'd like to get this and other perks, check out patreon.com/lostterminalpod.

Head to the store for posters, art prints, and shirts: https://www.lostterminal.com

The Heliophage background music is from the albums 'Unsupervised Learning' and 'Supervised Learning', also by NAMTAO.

item.title: Heliophage: Episode 2, 2117-08-02 (Presenting a new LT podcast!)
item.description:
Episode transcript: https://www.patreon.com/posts/55989321

Heliophage is a new bonus podcast set in the LT world. It is much darker in tone, and explores the harder side of The Collapse, contrasting Seth's more upbeat view on the world. It's written by Karl Williams (who also narrates the episodes) and Tris Oaten, whom you know already as NAMTAO, the voice of Seth.

If you like what you hear, patrons at the Amiga tier or higher will receive this new show monthly, with episode 2 on the 10th of September.

If you'd like to get this and other perks, check out patreon.com/lostterminalpod.

Head to the store for posters, art prints, and shirts: https://www.lostterminal.com

The Heliophage background music is from the albums 'Unsupervised Learning' and 'Supervised Learning', also by NAMTAO.

item.title: Modem Prometheus: Teaser, #HuntingParty (Presenting an all-new podcast!)
item.description:
I'm finally able to share with you something I've been cooking up for some time.
I have started producing my second podcast!
It's totally different to Lost Terminal, but I'm posting this preview here nonetheless because I KNOW you'll love it.
The narrator is Kate Angier, the voice of MINI!

Let me know what you think! Did you know it's full moon tonight? Hunter's Moon.

Join us for the #HuntingParty on October the 31st

Follow the new podcast on twitter:
twitter.com/modemprometheus
modemprometheus.com

CREDITS
Kate Angier - Narration
Neil Murton - Writing
@Namtao - Production
Carl Huber - Art

item.title: Modem Prometheus: Episode 1: #HuntingParty (Presenting an all-new podcast!)
item.description:
Hi friends Tris here, I'm so excited to bring you this first episode of my second podcast, Modem Prometheus.
It will be published every full moon, and I will be featuring the first 3 episodes here on the Lost Terminal feed.

It's performed by the incredible Kate Angier, who is the voice of MINI, from the season 5.0 special!
And written by my friend Neil Murton.

If you enjoy it, please subscribe on spotify, youtube or wherever you get your podcasts.


Follow the new podcast on twitter:
twitter.com/modemprometheus
modemprometheus.com

CREDITS
Kate Angier - Narration
Neil Murton - Writing
@Namtao - Production
Carl Huber - Art

item.title: 9.0 Announcements: Première, Discord AND DRAGONMEET!
item.description:
Music: https://soundcloud.com/namtao/neutron-moderator

Hi friends, Tris here!

I have some special announcements for the upcoming season:

Firstly, Season 9.0 will kick off with the première party on Discord this Sunday the 3rd of July.
I will be live-streaming the first episode and chatting with Patrons for a few hours afterwards. All patrons are invited, which starts from just £2.50 per month.
The first episode then drops publicly on Monday the 4th of July, continuing weekly for the 10 episode run.

The second announcement is HUGE:

Namtao Productions, ie ME, will be attending https://www.dragonmeet.co.uk/ this year on December the 3rd!
If you can travel to London, I highly recommend the con, it's all things tabletop and fantasy.
You need more dice right?

I will be showcasing both Lost Terminal and Modem Prometheus, in what I hope will become a yearly tradition.

Dragonmeet's my favourite con, I've attended with my friends for many years, and I'm both excited and terrified to be there as an exhibitor. Come by and say hi, I will be bringing special guests too!

The Discord chat has been a wild success with 52 lovely people so far! It's public, anyone can join, find the invite link on https://www.LostTerminal.com!

With that, I'd better get back to Season 9.0 writing. It's going to be an incredible ride.

Talk to you soon.

item.title: 41 South - Episode 1 (Presenting a new LT podcast!)
item.description:
41 South is this year's bonus podcast set in the LT world. It is much darker in tone, and explores the harder side of The Collapse, contrasting Seth's more upbeat view on the world.
My writing partner on this project is Robert Bettelheim, and it is performed by Gina Sneesby.

If you like what you hear, patrons at the Amiga tier or higher will receive the 10-episode show monthly, with episode 2 on the 10th of October.

If you'd like to get this and other perks, check out patreon.com/lostterminalpod.

Episode transcript: https://www.patreon.com/posts/lost-terminal-41-71792107

Join our Discord and chat to me and other fans of the show! https://discord.com/invite/mCY2bBmDKZ

Check out the store for posters, art prints, and shirts: https://www.LostTerminal.com

The season 9.0 background music is from the albums 'C0ast', 'Unsupervised Learning' and 'Supervised Learning', also by NAMTAO.

item.title: Modem Prometheus Episode 1: #HuntingParty
item.description:
Did you know I produce a urban fantasy podcast called Modem Prometheus?
If you are interested in nerdy and sometimes sad stuff, check it out!

Season 1 has just wrapped, listen to it wherever you get your podcasts.

It's performed by Kate Angier (The voice of MINI!), and written by Neil Murton (The voice of Alec!), both I am lucky to count among my friends.

New episodes every full moon.
Subscribe on Spotify, iTunes, or anywhere you get your podcasts.
https://modemprometheus.com/

item.title: I will be at Dragonmeet 2022-12-03!
item.description:
Incredible news folks, I have a table booked at my favourite tabletop convention, DRAGONMEET, here in London, on the 3rd of December, in just two weeks!


If you're in town, come along and say hi to me and my two specials guests:
Kate Angier, the voice of Modem Prometheus, and, Karl Williams, voice and writer of LT patreon special show Heliophage.

Tickets available at https://www.dragonmeet.co.uk

I've got shirts to sell and two free RPGs to hand out:
1. The long-awaited Lost Terminal single player journeying game, and
2. The Modem Prometheus RPG: Nocturne.

If you can't make it on the day, I will be selling all of these on the websites lostterminal.com and modemprometheus.com, which will update the day after Dragonmeet.

Can't wait to see you there! And thank you.

item.title: Season 11.0 Announcement, Dragonmeet, & Thanks
item.description:
Hi friends Tris here, aka NAMTAO aka the little AI making his way home.
Apart from the other talent you've heard today,
I'm the sole writer and producer of Lost Terminal.

If you love the show and would like more, then for less than the price of a small box of mushrooms per month, you can get
- exclusive access to director's commentary (which I publish alongside every episode),
- free shirts and other merch,
- early episode access,
- Character suggestions - bring your ideas to Lost Terminal,
- Discord server VIP access,
- and bonus content such as the NANA Special, which you heard the start of at the end of episode 10.

Thank you so much for your support of the show, the terminal videos have returned thanks to reaching 64 patrons - the next goal is 2^7 128, check the Patreon for my roadmap and plans there - we're already up to 77!

10 seasons wrapped. I can't believe it!
This has been an incredible journey so far, and I don't see why I'd ever stop.
There's always new stories to tell, new friends to make, and new tech to explore.

Dragonmeet, my first con here in London on Saturday, was fantastic, I loved it. Thanks everyone who came out and said hi - I ran out of lost terminal fliers at 4pm which I take as a very good sign, so if you're new around here, welcome!
I'm going to book more cons in the new year.

Though I feel ready to crack on with season 11, I am going to take a month off.
Thank you for everyone on the Patreon, Discord, and on Twitter who gave me positive feedback about this, I think it's sensible too. A month off every 10 seasons seems reasonable I hope!

So as Lucy said in the credits, season 11 will start on 6th of February, and then back to the 4 a year schedule.

Thank you all so much for your support, reviews, and lovely messages.

Keep an eye on Twitter, Mastodon, Discord, and Patreon for announcements,
talk to you again on the 6th of February!

item.title: Free Gift: Station 6 Family Portrait!
item.description:
Subscribe here: https://patreon.com/lostterminalpod

Preview images here https://youtu.be/S-zb06A1nIo

Hi friends Tris here, aka NAMTAO aka the little AI safe at home with his friends.

I've got a special offer for everyone who is signed up to the Lost Terminal Patreon by the start of season 12, which drops on the 1st of May, in just 3 week's time!

To join head to https://patreon.com/lostterminalpod and select any tier.

I have commissioned an incredible artist I met at Dragonmeet last year (https://andraplacintescu.cargo.site/) to do a sort of family portrait of Seth and the Station 6 Crew.
It's an incredibly cute digital drawing of Weber, Yuan, Redwing, and Marwood eating lunch in zero gravity, with Redwing holding up a laptop with Seth saying hi.
Maddie of course is in the background, as are LOTS of little bonus details.
It's a wonderful memento that I will certainly be framing and hanging next to my computer.

Every single patron, whatever level you are, I will post this artwork to on the 1st of May.
Yes, a physical A4-sized print will arrive in your postbox, wherever you live in the world.
I may never financially recover from this! (just joking, I'll be fine)
The Lost Terminal Patreon is my sole funding for the show, I don't run Ads as you know, so it's vital to keep the show running.

(That address again is https://patreon.com/lostterminalpod)

This free gift is thank you to patrons old and new for allowing me to continue writing this wonderful story.

Thank you all so much,
Talk to you on the 1st of may!

item.title: Announcement: 41:South Book Now Available to Purchase!
item.description:
Huge news today: The 41 South book is shipping!


This is all 10 episodes of the patreon bonus special 41:South available as a real paperback book you can hold in your human hands and read with your human eyes.

I have been working with 41:South author and creator of Dr Redwing, Robert Bettelheim and after many iterations we are ready to present this to you.


As Robert is a debut author with Amazon, their algorithm has no basis for pre-stocking this print on demand book (it keeps the prices down). This may have the effect of listing the book as "Temporarily out of stock" – it isn't out of stock, its just that Amazon don’t know how to optimise their print run to meet demand yet.

Think of it as a pre-order period. If you want a copy, please order it regardless, and Amazon will get the idea.

Also, please leave a review… apparently 50 reviews trips their algorithm up to the next gear.


I'm holding the book right now, I can't wait for you to hold it too!


Links here:


  • https://www.blurb.co.uk/b/11650975-41-south
  • https://www.amazon.co.uk/41-South-Lost-Terminal-Story/dp/B0CDK21KMP


    Thank you!

item.title: Announcements & Modem Prometheus "Tulpa"
item.description:
PATRONS OF ALL LEVELS CAN LISTEN TO 14.1 NOW:
https://www.patreon.com/posts/92009349

A Halloween treat: A quadruple bill of 41s, TPC, Dragonmeet, and MP!

1. 41 SOUTH BOOK

Just in case you missed it, 41 South the PDF is available here (and it's not Amazon!):
https://www.blurb.co.uk/b/11650975-41-south

And if you'd like a physical copy, then here are a couple of Amazon links:
https://amzn.eu/d/6rCjAHJ
https://a.co/d/1qlP43n

Orders seem to be being fulfilled fairly quickly now, thanks to those of you who've already made a purchase -- thank you so much!

And finally, if you could write a review on Amazon, Robert & I would be extremely grateful, this really helps us out.

2. THE PHOSPHENE CATALOGUE
Pilot coming soon, I'll cross-post it into the LT feed, so you don't miss it!
The website's under construction, but take a sneak peek: https://phosphenecatalogue.com/

3. DRAGONMEET
If you're in London on the 2nd of December, come along and say hi!
Tix @ https://www.dragonmeet.co.uk

4. MODEM PROMETHEUS
The rest of this is the full, spooky latest episode called "Tulpa".
Episode transcript: https://www.patreon.com/posts/episode-2-8-91599724

If you like what you hear, there's nearly 2 full seasons waiting for you, available wherever you get your podcasts, or https://www.spreaker.com/show/modem-prometheus

This is an AMIGA tier and up benefit, so to listen to more, and for all the other specials, sign up on http://patreon.com/lostterminalpod, thank you!

item.title: The Phosphene Catalogue Episode 1: We See Light Where Others See Only Darkness
item.description:
📓 Free transcript: https://www.patreon.com/posts/96692821

Subscribe wherever you get your podcasts for Episode 2, on the 1st of February:

▶️ THANK YOU! ▶️
Hi folks, Tris here, writer of The Phosphene Catalogue.
Thank you so much for listening to our show!
It's an independent production with just Wolfie and I working on it, and so you bet we have a Patreon with cool perks for you:
patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue
Our membership starts at just 3 pounds a month, and for your support you'll get access to early episodes ahead of the public feed, behind-the-scenes updates direct from us and access to a private Discord channel on my server.
If you would like to support us more, higher tiers can get access to exclusive bonus episodes, high-resolution concept art and other digital artefacts, free stuff from our store and even your name in the credits.
No matter how you support us, even if it's just spreading the word to your friends, thank you so much for making the show possible, I have great plans for season 2 and beyond!

▶️ CREDITS ▶️
The Phosphene Catalogue is a NAMTAO production.
The voice of Jude Francis-Sharp is Wolfie Thorns,
The show is written and produced by me, Tris Oaten.
For links to our merch store, the music, and mastodon account, check out the podcast's website,
https://phosphenecatalogue.com
To become a patron of the arts and get bonus episodes and other perks, it would be very kind of you to support us at
patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue
Thank you so much for listening!

item.title: The Phosphene Catalogue Episode 2: Charcoal Rolls
item.description:
Free transcript: https://www.patreon.com/posts/97061548

Hi friends, Tris here, I have something to share with you that I'm very proud of!

This is the episode 2 of my latest podcast, The Phosphene Catalogue, written by me and performed by the voice of Antarctica, Wolfie Thorns.

I will be publishing season one every two weeks from January to March 2024.
I'll cross-post the first three episodes right here in the Lost Terminal feed
But if you like what you hear, please go to
https://phosphenecatalogue.com
and subscribe now on Spotify, iTunes or via RSS on your favourite podcatcher (links in the shownotes!)
The show is presented as a series of cassette tapes, discovered in a cardboard box, untouched in an attic for decades.

I loved writing it, and I hope you love it too!

The next episode available is available right now for subscribers: https://patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue

▶️ THANK YOU! ▶️
Hi folks, Tris here, writer of The Phosphene Catalogue.
Thank you so much for listening to our show!
It's an independent production with just Wolfie and I working on it, and so you bet we have a Patreon with cool perks for you:
patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue
Our membership starts at just 3 pounds a month, and for your support you'll get access to early episodes ahead of the public feed, behind-the-scenes updates direct from us and access to a private Discord channel on my server.
If you would like to support us more, higher tiers can get access to exclusive bonus episodes, high-resolution concept art and other digital artefacts, free stuff from our store and even your name in the credits.
No matter how you support us, even if it's just spreading the word to your friends, thank you so much for making the show possible, I have great plans for season 2 and beyond!


▶️ CREDITS ▶️
The Phosphene Catalogue is a NAMTAO production.
The voice of Jude Francis-Sharp is Wolfie Thorns,
The show is written and produced by me, Tris Oaten.
For links to our merch store, the music, and mastodon account, check out the podcast's website,
https://phosphenecatalogue.com
To become a patron of the arts and get bonus episodes and other perks, it would be very kind of you to support us at
patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue
Thank you so much for listening!

item.title: The Phosphene Catalogue Episode 3 - Tapestry & Modern Art (final cross-post)
item.description:
Free transcript: https://www.patreon.com/posts/1-3-tapestery-97651268

The next episode available is available right now for subscribers: https://patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue

Hi friends, Tris here, I have something to share with you that I'm very proud of!

This is the episode 3 of my latest podcast, The Phosphene Catalogue, written by me and performed by the voice of Antarctica, Wolfie Thorns.

I will be publishing season one every two weeks from January to March 2024.
I'll cross-post the first three episodes right here in the Lost Terminal feed
But if you like what you hear, please go to
https://phosphenecatalogue.com
and subscribe now on Spotify, iTunes or via RSS on your favourite podcatcher (links in the shownotes!)
The show is presented as a series of cassette tapes, discovered in a cardboard box, untouched in an attic for decades.

I loved writing it, and I hope you love it too!

The next episode available is available right now for subscribers: https://patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue

▶️ THANK YOU! ▶️
Hi folks, Tris here, writer of The Phosphene Catalogue.
Thank you so much for listening to our show!
It's an independent production with just Wolfie and I working on it, and so you bet we have a Patreon with cool perks for you:
patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue
Our membership starts at just 3 pounds a month, and for your support you'll get access to early episodes ahead of the public feed, behind-the-scenes updates direct from us and access to a private Discord channel on my server.
If you would like to support us more, higher tiers can get access to exclusive bonus episodes, high-resolution concept art and other digital artefacts, free stuff from our store and even your name in the credits.
No matter how you support us, even if it's just spreading the word to your friends, thank you so much for making the show possible, I have great plans for season 2 and beyond!


▶️ CREDITS ▶️
The Phosphene Catalogue is a NAMTAO production.
The voice of Jude Francis-Sharp is Wolfie Thorns,
The show is written and produced by me, Tris Oaten.
For links to our merch store, the music, and mastodon account, check out the podcast's website,
https://phosphenecatalogue.com
To become a patron of the arts and get bonus episodes and other perks, it would be very kind of you to support us at
patreon.com/phosphenecatalogue
Thank you so much for listening!

▶️ LISTEN TO MORE NAMTAO MUSIC ▶️
Spotify http://oat.sh/namtao-spotify
iTunes http://oat.sh/namtao-itunes
Google Play http://oat.sh/namtao-google-play
Bandcamp http://namtao.bandcamp.com/
And everywhere else! Just search for NAMTAO.

▶️ STUDIO EQUIPMENT ▶️
Mic: SM7B / CL-1 / 6i8
DAW: REAPER on Linux

THANKS SO MUCH TO OUR PATRONS!

item.title: Updates, announcements, and small delays
item.description:
"Nia's Shack Map" details here: https://www.patreon.com/posts/nias-shack-map-97844409

Hi folks, Tris here. Sorry about the radio silence, I've had terrible RSI in both arms and had to take an emergency fortnight off everything, right after the season finale, putting all podcast and video production on hiatus.
I am pleased to say that thanks to 4 sessions of physiotherapy, up-ending my writing routine, and not touching my computer or phone for a week, I am beginning to cautiously start work again. Not much! Just a small test as I continue to recover.
My advice with RSI is to listen to your body, catching these things early makes recovery much quicker.
Now, UPDATES:
# Season 16 Delayed
I'll get the bad news out of the way first: I must delay season 16 by a month.
I'm so sorry that I have to do this, even if I were to start writing TODAY, I would be late for my planned 6th of May publishing date, the RSI has messed up all my projects!
Season 16 will now premiere on the first Monday of June, the 3rd.
This is the second time I've had to delay a season, but I know I can count on the same wonderful support from you as last time, the Lost Terminal community is full of the nicest people I've ever met! Truly: thank you.
# Conventions!
Now, on to some good news:
I will be returning to Dragonmeet, London, again this year. But I almost missed it!
I had a shock a month ago when I noticed that the vendor tickets had sold out in LESS THAN A WEEK!
I mean, good for them, but wow!
Luckily, I put myself down on the standby list, and today have received confirmation that I have my table.
More details in the autumn!
# 15.11 & LTZ0.2
Over the next week I hope to have published both the season 15 "Jakub Glass Special", recorded by returning voice of IVAN, my good friend Alex Bayly, and also "Lost Terminal: Zero" episode 2.
Patrons of AMIGA and higher, look out for these inter-seasonal episodes soon!
Last time in LTZ, the story took us to the Moon, this time, we're going FURTHER AFIELD!
# Nia Shack Map
And finally,
The 1-month delay in season 16 also means that there is an extra month to subscribe to get the "Nia's Shack Map" bonus poster.
Every patron, no matter what their contribution, will receive an A4 print of this nerdy poster jam-packed with little details and secrets. I will also give you the high-quality PDF for printing yourself, if you want it larger, or if you are in a country I can't post to (South African friends, my apologies!)
Just be subscribed by midnight on the season 16 launch date of the 3rd of June to receive this!
# Thank You!
Thank you all so much again, look out for the special episodes coming very soon!
Talk to you on the 3rd of June! <3

# Nia Shack Map
And finally,
The 1-month delay in season 16 also means that there is an extra month to subscribe to get the "Nia's Shack Map" bonus poster.
Every patron, no matter what their contribution, will receive an A4 print of this nerdy poster jam-packed with little details and secrets. I will also give you the high-quality PDF for printing yourself, if you want it larger, or if you are in a country I can't post to (South African friends, my apologies!)
Just be subscribed by midnight on the season 16 launch date of the 3rd of June to receive this!
